item.description:
On April 10 at a town hall meeting in Jensen Beach, FL, Republican congressman Allen West claimed 78-81 members of Congress are members of the Communist Party, echoing insinuations and accusations by illustrious characters like Michelle Bachmann and Rush Limbaugh. Fast reverse to the thirties through the fifties and the era of the communist witch hunts of HUAC and the McCarthy hearings. "None without Sin; Kazan, Miller, and the Blacklist" is a thoroughly stunning retrospective of the events that bring us into the political and social fabric that we see evolving today with predictable and saddening implications.

Join us on Saturday, June 2, for this enlightening film from 2003 PBS American Experience series which will undoubtedly provoke much thought and lively conversation.

It's by no means required, but if you can see Elia Kazan's "On the Waterfront" before this event, you'll have a little more context than if you don't.

Please note that we're starting a half hour earlier than usual due to the length of the film.

Refreshments will be served.
